reviews.review_text:
Enjoy a breezy afternoon sipping on some beers or cocktails and Goan food on the first floor of this restaurant.

With the beautiful view of the town below, this probably is the selling point of this restaurant.

The food is good but the view is better.
Just spend a lazy afternoon here and enjoy your food.

We wanted to go for a rainy Sunday afternoon thali and had heard good things about this place. Unfortunately they don’t serve their thalis on Sunday.
We stayed for lunch anyway.

The service was quite relaxed in the typical Goan style, but it was worth the wait with the amazing prawn curry and prawn rava fry which were just outstanding and our favourites!

We also had silver fish fry, chinak fry -‘d surmai fry, along with some fish caldin.
These were all good, but not the best we’ve ever eaten.

What makes this place worth it is the prawn curry of course, but also the stunning views! It is in a gorgeous green location overlooking trees and was absolutely perfect in the monsoon!

They also have an AC section which would be great during the summers, but then you lose the views.

It’s a good option if you’re in mapusa and want a nice open space instead of being in a cramped restaurant.

The food was decent but the service was very slow . The waiter didn't even clear our plate once done with starters. We came through swiggy dine out and it was mentioned with free drink but the restaurant disagreed and caused a problem. The worst part was the serradura desert i had. It was just full of cream and only pinch of biscuit powder. It was very upsetting. Please improve on these points. Would love to change my reviews about it in the near future. Thank you.
